body_html:
@edgarriba so position sensitive roi pooling was proposed in RFCN paper, it is ROI pooling + average pooling, the inputs are features, rois, number of classes, and the h and w of the deisre output, and the output is in shape of #rois x #classes x w x h
I tried to do it in this post, but have some issue in the backward pass

I tried to do it in this post, but have some issue in the backward pass
body:
@edgarriba so position sensitive roi pooling was proposed in RFCN paper, it is ROI pooling + average pooling, the inputs are features, rois, number of classes, and the h and w of the deisre output, and the output is in shape of #rois x #classes x w x h
I tried to do it in this [post](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/how-to-deal-with-backward-pass-in-pytorch-version-of-roi-pooling/28304), but have some issue in the backward pass
